bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Frederick F. Russell, November 24, 1929

div1.p: [Carter] talks about the maps that have been prepared for the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Frederick F. Russell, November 24, 1929
div1.opener:
Mem: Mr. N. B. Johnson (Geological Survey- Map Division
5008-5th St. N.W.
Washington D.C.
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
November 24, 1929.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
I am herein enclosing receipted bill for twenty dollars ($20.00)
(N. B. Johnson, November 8, 1929) for work done this summer on two
maps for the History of Yellow Fever.

These maps are not yet completed (see details in my first letter
of Nov. [unclear]29, in which this is enclosed). I felt, however, that
further delay in payment would be unfair to Mr. Johnson, as I had told
the Chief Illustrator, who turned the maps over to him early this
summer, that Dr. Frost and I would need them by August 1st., at which
time he had them ready and waiting for us.

Mr. Johnson has had to do a good deal of parallel reading, as
well as considerable work in the Map Division of the Library of Con-
gress before he could incorporate, from different sources, what Father's
MS called for on these maps.

I have no expense account books, indeed have been too busy to
keep an accurate record of my small expenditures (paper, cards, upkeep of
two typewriters etc.) in connection with work on the book. The enclosed
is, however, the only considerable item since my return to Washington
this fall and the only one I am turning in.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, 1 enclosure.
Dr. F. F. Russell, Director,
International Health Division,
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
